intro: Timonius peduncularis, commonly known as the slender-stalked timonius, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Timonius peduncularis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
